info.title: Orbit API
info.description: Please see the complete Orbit API documentation at [https://docs.orbit.love/reference](https://docs.orbit.love/reference).

bearer.name: Authorization
bearer.description: Provide a Authorization header with format 'Bearer <api_key>'. This is the recommended approach. Make sure to include the 'Bearer' part in the text box here.

api_key.name: api_key
api_key.description: Provide the API key in a query param called api_key. This is the least secure method, please use only for testing.

description.description: A description of the activity; displayed in the timeline

link.description: A URL for the activity; displayed in the timeline

link_text.description: The text for the timeline link

title.description: A title for the activity; displayed in the timeline

weight.description: A custom weight to be used in filters and reports; defaults to 1.

activity_type.description: The type of activity - what action was done by the member. This is a legacy field, use activity_type_key instead.

activity_type_key.description: The key for a custom activity type for the workspace. Will create a new activity type if it does not exist.

key.description: Supply a key that must be unique or leave blank to have one generated.

occurred_at.description: The date and time the activity occurred; defaults to now

properties.description: Key-value pairs to provide contextual metadata about an activity.

occurred_at.description: The date and time at which the content was published; defaults to now

tags_to_add.description: Adds tags to member; comma-separated string or array

tags.description: Replaces all tags for the member; comma-separated string or array

tag_list.description: Deprecated: Please use the tags attribute instead

linkedin.description: The member's LinkedIn username, without the in/ or pub/

identity.description: Represents an email address, a profile on networks like github and twitter, or a record in another system.

name.description: The name of the person in the source system

source.description: The type of source: known values include github, twitter, discourse, email, linkedin, devto. Custom values can also be used

source_host.description: Specifies the location of the source, such as the host of a Discourse instance

username.description: The username of the person in the source system

uid.description: The uid of the person in the source system

email.description: The email of the person in the source system

url.description: For custom identities, an optional link to the profile on the source system

get.summary: Get info about the current user

post.summary: Create a Custom or a Content activity for a new or existing member
post.description: Use this method when you know an identity of the member (github, email, twitter, etc.) but not their Orbit ID. Pass fields in the member object to update the member in addition to creating the activity.

base: Either identity or member name, email, GitHub, Twitter or Discourse is required

attributes.bio: dzello.com/blog/2020/05/3… Co-founder & CTO @OrbitModel · advocate for dev advocates 🥑 · formerly @algolia and @keen_io · Ruby · Rails · JAMstack · he/him
attributes.name: Josh Dzielak

get.summary: Get an activity in the workspace
List all activity types for a workspace

post.summary: Create a Custom or a Content activity for a member

put.summary: Update a custom activity for a member

422.description: identity is invalid or not attached to member

identity: is not attached to this member

post.description: This method is useful when you know a member's identity in another system and want to create or update the corresponding Orbit member. Identities can be specified in the identity object or member attributes like member.github. If no member exists, a new member will be created and linked to any provided identities.

attributes.bio: Co-founder & CTO @orbit-love · Developer Advocate · formerly @algolia and @keen
attributes.name: Josh Dzielak

get.summary: Find a member by an identity
get.description: Provide a source and one of username/uid/email params to return a member with that identity, if one exists. Common values for source include github, twitter, and email.

parameters.name: github
parameters.description: Deprecated, please use source=github and username=<username> instead

example.errors: No member matching this identity was found

get.summary: List member activities in an organization
Get all workspaces for the current user
